content.description: Stand start with a right hand crimp on the right side about head height, and a left hand side pull about waist height. Good right foot, smear the left where you can find traction. Climb the “ladder” until the juggy-crimps run out, then stand with a high right foot and swing your right hand high to the top.

Start with left hand on obvious jug, right hand jam between the two boulders. Reach for slopper with left hand, pull right hand out of jam into an undercling, bump left hand up to crimp then swing right foot out to stand on the crack while matching with the right hand on a decent side pull just above left hand. Walk your feet to the left and bring your left foot up to the starting jug. Throw right hand for top jug and mantle over the edge.
content.location: Left most problem on the south face of boulder

content.description: Start with a double hand jam and left foot chip on the right side of the south face. Bring the right foot up onto the crack between the two boulders. Reach up with the right hand and grab a good ledge on the top right side of the concave face. Switch feet and smear the right foot across the bottom of the top boulder right above the lateral crack. Keep hips close to the wall and move up with the left hand to balance on good Gaston before reaching all the way up to the top. Shift feet and mantle out.
content.location: Far right of south face of boulder

content.description: Same start as Line 33, once you bump the left hand up to the crimp, move up with the right foot to a small ledge just above the crack between the two boulders. Bring the right hand up from the undercling to an obvious side pull above your head. Move the left foot to a heel hook on the start jug and bump both hands up to the top. Mantle finish.
content.location: Start on Line 33, move right and straight up.

content.description: Begin on decent left hand and right hand side pull, left foot on a micro foot chip that you have to search for, right foot is smeared against the base of the rock. Bring left hand up to a Gaston crimp above your head, right hand reaches around the north side of the boulder to a sloper, bring left foot up to a better position, then jump for the top. Mantle out. Be careful as this has a bad landing and the climber is exposed to an approximately 8 foot drop off to rocks and bushes to the left.
content.location: On the “second level” up the hillside. East side of boulder.
